(This note will not be included.)}} :The DI_ITEM* flags determine the anchor point of the HUD element, i.e. how it is placed relative to the specified position. By default elements are drawn from their top left corner. The following flags determine the anchor point: :*{{c|DI_ITEM_TOP}} - top. Combine with DI_ITEM_CENTER to anchor at the top center. :*{{c|DI_ITEM_BOTTOM}} - bottom. Combine with DI_ITEM_CENTER to anchor at the bottom center. :*{{c|DI_ITEM_LEFT}} - left side. Combine with DI_ITEM_CENTER to anchor at the center of the left side. :*{{c|DI_ITEM_RIGHT}} - right side. Combine with DI_ITEM_CENTER to anchor at the center of the right side. :*{{c|DI_ITEM_LEFT_TOP}} - top left corner (same as DI_ITEM_TOP|DI_ITEM_LEFT) :*{{c|DI_ITEM_RIGHT_TOP}} - top right corner (same as DI_ITEM_TOP|DI_ITEM_RIGHT) :*{{c|DI_ITEM_LEFT_BOTTOM}} - bottom left corner (same as DI_ITEM_BOTTOM|DI_ITEM_LEFT) :*{{c|DI_ITEM_RIGHT_BOTTOM}} - bottom right corner (same as DI_ITEM_BOTTOM|DI_ITEM_RIGHT) :*{{c|DI_ITEM_CENTER}} - center point :*{{c|DI_ITEM_OFFSETS}} - The element's built-in offsets (as set in SLADE) are taken into account. :Note, these flags do not change the orientation of coordinates. Regardless of the element's anchor point, positive X moves it to the right, positive Y moves it down. :More flags are defined in the [https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/blob/e7a79b0d448759b8cfe51e325f8a0b36cf340041/wadsrc/static/zscript/engine/ui/statusbar/statusbarcore.zs#L53 StatusBarCore] class), but they're mostly aliases of the above ones.[[Category:Include templates]]
